to get to know your baby.
Even if you decided before the 
birth not to breastfeed, this 
may be a really good time to 
give it a go and see what you 
think. You might change your 
mind!
The	first	milk	you	produce	in	
the days after the birth (called 
colostrum) contains antibodies 
that will help protect your 
baby from infection, so even 
if you decide not to continue 
breastfeeding, your baby will 
benefit	from	those	first	few	
feeds.
